text: Black British are people who live in the United Kingdom that are Black. The 2001 UK censusNational Statistics Online - Ethnicity says there were 1.2 million Black British people. They were 2.33% of the population of the England and Wales. In the 2021 census 4% of people said they were Black, Black British, Black Welsh, Caribbean or African. That was 2.4 million people in England and Wales. In the past, Black British used to mean any British person who was not Causasian, like British Asians, but people say that it was because of racism in England at that time. ==References== *
title: Black British
